N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.9 - Review of denial of application for plan acceptance

State Regulations
(a) When an application for acceptance of a
plan has been denied on the ground that the benefits under the plan do not meet
the requirements of section 358- 3.1 of this Subpart, the applicant, within 15
days after notice of such denial has been given, may apply in writing to the
chairman for review. In support of his application for review, and as a part of
such application, the applicant shall submit a memorandum of the facts on the
basis of which he contends that the benefits provided under the plan are, notwithstanding the requirements of section
358-3.1, at least as favorable as
the disability benefits under section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law. (b) The chairman, or an officer or employee
of the board designated by the chairman for that purpose, shall review the
application and plan, and the chairman may direct that a hearing be held for
the taking of evidence and for such other consideration as the proofs
warrant. (c) Upon such review, the
chairman, or the officer or employee designated by the chairman, may make a
variation from the provisions of section
358-3.1
of this Subpart, provided
such variation reflects the general intent and purpose of section 211 and is in
the interest of justice. Notes
